meanings.definition: To make oneself comfortable and warm
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she enjoys cosying up on the couch with a soft blanket.
meanings.sent2: During winter, people love cosying by the fireplace to stay warm.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cosying in the sunbeam, looking utterly content.
meanings.sent4: The old couple cosied together under the quilt, sharing stories of their youth.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of cosying in freshly washed sheets is pure bliss.

meanings.sent1: He was cosying up to his boss in hopes of getting a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The siblings were cosying together on the sofa while watching a movie.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was cosying up to its owner, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The politician was cosying to the voters, promising positive changes.
meanings.sent5: The child cosying to their favorite stuffed animal for comfort.

meanings.definition: The act of creating a cozy atmosphere
meanings.sent1: She loved the cosying of her home with warm lights and soft cushions.
meanings.sent2: The cosying of the cabin with candles and blankets made it feel like a retreat.
meanings.sent3: The cosying of the cafe with fairy lights and comfy chairs attracted many customers.
meanings.sent4: The cosying of the garden with colorful flowers and a small fountain was enchanting.
meanings.sent5: The cosying of the classroom with posters and bean bags made learning fun.
